Actually, this problem occurs when added fragments rather than plug-ins.

This was always a problem (happens with the old editor too). I don't think it 
makes sense for a feature to depend on a fragment, so I fixed by filtering 
fragments from the list. The fix is only in the new editor.

Just tried this out and I think fragments are being sneaky and getting past the
filter :(

Reason for this is because I just tried to "Add Plug-in" and fragments are still
in the viewer.  If I select on a fragment, I get the error below:  (note that
plug-ins still work fine) :)
